Wisdom *__03.1: But the souls of the just are in the hand of God, and the torment of death shall not touch them.
Wisdom *__03.2: In the sight of the unwise they seemed to die: and their departure was taken for misery:
Wisdom *__03.3: And their going away from us, for utter destruction: but they are in peace.
Wisdom *__03.4: And though in the sight of men they suffered torments, their hope is full of immortality.
Wisdom *__03.5: Afflicted in few things, in many they shall be well rewarded: because God hath tried them, and found them worthy of himself.
Wisdom *__03.6: As gold in the furnace he hath proved them, and as a victim of a holocaust he hath received them, and in time there shall be respect had to them.
Wisdom *__03.7: The just shall shine, and shall run to and fro like sparks among the reeds.
Wisdom *__03.8: They shall judge nations, and rule over people, and their Lord shall reign for ever.
Wisdom *__03.9: They that trust in him, shall understand the truth: and they that are faithful in love shall rest in him: for grace and peace is to his elect.
Wisdom *__03.10: But the wicked shall be punished according to their own devices: who have neglected the just, and have revolted from the Lord.
Wisdom *__03.11: For he that rejecteth wisdom, and discipline, is unhappy: and their hope is vain, and their labours without fruit, and their works unprofitable.
Wisdom *__03.12: Their wives are foolish, and their children wicked.
Wisdom *__03.13: Their offspring is cursed: for happy is the barren: and the undefiled, that hath not known bed in sin: she shall have fruit in the visitation of holy souls.
Wisdom *__03.14: And the eunuch, that hath not wrought iniquity with his hands, nor thought wicked things against God: for the precious gift of faith shall be given to him, and a most acceptable lot in the temple of God.
Wisdom *__03.15: For the fruit of good labours is glorious, and the root of wisdom never faileth.
Wisdom *__03.16: But the children of adulterers shall not come to perfection, and the seed of the unlawful bed shall be rooted out.
Wisdom *__03.17: And if they live long, they shall be nothing regarded, and their last old age shall be without honour.
Wisdom *__03.18: And if they die quickly, they shall have no hope, nor speech of comfort in the day of trial.
Wisdom *__03.19: For dreadful are the ends of a wicked race.
